column4: anyone? i tried to make a launcher for a bash script but it doesn't run as expected..i get no visible output
you probably need the launcher to specify "run in terminal"
or make the command for instance " gnome-terminal -e <yourdcript> "
s/dcript/script
what does the last one do? s/dcript/script ?
oh sorry I was correcting my typo :)
ah..ok
gnome-terminal -e <name of scipt >
i'm assuming if gnome-terminal is used as an argument for the command, the "run in terminal" check box must be unchecked..
you can make any command run in a terminal by saying " xterm -e command" or whatever
probably - haven't tried it
I ususally jsut say " aterm -e <mycommand> "
the script actually calls /usr/local/java/bin/java foo.jar
and it works fine if i run that from the terminal. i just need a launcher on the desktop to do the same..
should work then, as discussed - try it and see
would it not be ... java -jar foo.jar ? (I'm not a java person)
the docs tell me to just do a java foo.jar. i'm not a java person too. hehe. anyway, it still doesn't launch the app. it does open a terminal though and closes it immediately thereafter
would it not be easier to just make a symlink to that path or add it to your path ?
oh..so an absolute path to the script in the command text box won't work? anyway, i'll try the symlink and see if it does..
an absolute path should work, yes
you didn't leave out the -e before your command. I hope?
oh - did you give the right pathe to your foo.jar?
